alert.note: Alert for Eastern, Central El Paso County; Rio Grande Valley of Eastern El Paso, Western Hudspeth Counties; Rio Grande Valley of Eastern Hudspeth County; Western El Paso County (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS El Paso (Southern New Mexico and extreme Western Texas)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued November 24 at 1:21PM CST by NWS El Paso
info.description: ***PERIODS OF LIGHT TO MODERATE SNOW POSSIBLE THROUGH FRIDAY NIGHT*** A potent winter storm is expected to move through area beginning this afternoon, lasting into early Saturday morning. The best chance for accumulating snow will be across portions of Hudspeth and Otero Counties where a winter storm warning and winter weather advisory remain in effect. Elsewhere, isolated to scattered rain and snow showers will be possible. Periods of moderate to heavy snowfall cannot be ruled out during the overnight periods. This could cause brief accumulations and travel impacts, especially on bridges, overpasses, and mountain passes. Little to no snowfall accumulation is expected for most locations, but a few isolated areas of 1 to 2 inches cannot be ruled out within these heavier snow showers.

area.areaDesc: Eastern, Central El Paso County; Rio Grande Valley of Eastern El Paso, Western Hudspeth Counties; Rio Grande Valley of Eastern Hudspeth County; Western El Paso County
